name: Disney's Grand Floridian Resort and Spa

reviews.text: Just returned from Orlando after a week at the Grand Floridian with my wife and 4 year old daughter. This hotel is fantastic and has everything you (and your kids) could ask for - proximity to the parks, great atmosphere, great staff and service and good food. Victoria & Alberts is an absolute must. It was the best fine dining experience I have ever had and I thoroughly recommend it.
reviews.title: Absolutely Magical

reviews.text: For those reviewers who complain about the price, you know how much it costs when you book it so maybe you should go somewhere else. The Grand Floridian is worth every penny. Make sure you ask for a room with a Magic Kingdom view. Absolutely Magical!!
reviews.title: Great location, service needs work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at GF April 10-15th. Check in was not a problem and our room was ready on time.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.disliked: — that I had to go home after 4 short days

reviews.text: The rooms are not large, but four(kids age 5 and 7) of us were comfortable as the beds were queen size. I felt that the value simply was not there for $495/night - plus taxes. Basically you pay for location which simply cannot be beat. It is just one stop away from Magic Kingdom on the monorail and a transfer to another monorail to get to Epcot.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay but had some problems

likes.disliked: — The price way too high for what it has to offer.

reviews.title: A Convenient Place to Stay for a Special Occassion
reviews.text: We were able to get a small fridge upon request.

I have been coming to this hotel for the last 24 years. It first opened in 1988. It is still very beautiful on the outside and in the lobby. It has wonderful landscaping and floral arrangements. The complaints that I am hearing about the rooms being rundown disturbs me greatly. I know the rooms are small but that has never bothered us before because we have always loved staying at the GF. It is nice to be so close to the magic kingdom and be in the middle of all the action. You can even watch the MK fireworks from the hotel. It is fun to see the boats and the monorail on the seven seas lagoon. The wedding pavilion is gorgeous and it is nice to see the brides and bridal parties in the lobby. The problem I had with this trip was that the lobby has gotten chaotic throughout the years. Due to the fact that the GF now has tea time at 1900 park fare and the princess tea party once or twice a day in the garden view lounge and also the fact that parents let their kids do whatever they want to, the posh beautiful lobby is like grand central station or as one employee put it "the Florida Mall". One night when the band was playing or the pianist was playing, numerous children were jumping on couches like they were trampolines, doing cartwheels and running like they were on a playground. I know this is Disney world but this place was anything but relaxing. It is even worse when the christmas decorations are up. They bus people in from the area to see the decorations and the place is packed. I also don't like these new "double wide" strollers. They were every where in WDW. And I had to get out of their way numerous times or I would have been run over. I was lucky enough to stay at the brand new GF villas which are disney vacation club villas. The place is like a mini GF hotel. It is very nice but after being open for only 3 weeks the room was already showing some issues. Scratched furniture, small holes in the wall, broken things in the room etc... Our room was also not in the cleanest condition upon arrival and that really shocked me. Disney used to be known for its cleanliness but that has all changed. It is so sad. Also the quality of the food has gone downhill in restaurants on disney property. I think this could be due to the disney dining plan. I was not on the plan and had issues with the quality of food at 3 different restaurants. I love disney world and the GF and it would be very sad if this wasn't one of my vacation destinations anymore. I hope Disney listens to what people are saying and they fix the issues. People are not going to pay top dollar for rooms that are small and in dire need of renovation. They also aren't going to pay for food that is not edible.
reviews.title: Love this hotel but it has changed over the years

reviews.text: After much research my wife and I decided to take our toddler to Disney for a few days last week. From what I could read online it looked as if the Grand Floridian was the best choice. We paid extra for what was to be a larger room with a harbor view.
reviews.title: Not pleased at all and not worth the money.

reviews.text: Upon arriving at 1:00 PM, they aid the room was not ready and that was fine. We waited around the lobby sitting area for another 2 hours with a two year old and at 3:00 I went back to check in and they said the room still was not ready. I asked what time check it was and they said 3:00. Another hour goes by and now it is 4:00 and they said the room was still not ready. That is three hours now. Finally at 4:30 I said I wanted to speak with a manager and they got us the room.
reviews.title: VERY GRAND

reviews.text: Once in the room we were floored at how small it was and our view of the harbor that we paid extra for was over half blocked by the building we were in. The small patio was filthy with cigarette butts, trash and dirt. There was a broken handle to the bathroom. The toilet seat was very loose and the shower hear was stuck in a position that faced the shower wall and wouldnt move.
reviews.title: Great location and staff

reviews.text: It was clear that this room should have been priced about $500 to $600 less per night and was comparable to a Dollar Inn or Days Inn.
reviews.title: MY FAVORITE HOTEL!!! LOVE IT!!!

reviews.text: My family and I just returned from our third stay at The Grand Floridian within the last six years; unfortunately, this may have been our last stay at The Grand due to the extremely poor customer service we received on multiple levels. Our first disappointing experience was during check-in when they had our oldest son listed as a child on our reservation (which would have included him receiving "child" meals with the dining plan) despite my having confirmation of our reservation with him as an "adult." We were instructed to go to the concierge desk to have this corrected and the young woman who helped us suggested we simply go to the parks and "see how he does with the children's menus." I informed her that during our last visit, the child's menu was not enough food for him and now, two years later, it certainly was not going to work. Additionally, I paid for him as an adult and I expected this to be corrected. After 40 minutes of waiting, the issue was resolved and she was very apologetic -- stating that the system had uploaded our reservation incorrectly and could she make it up to us with free FastPasses -- we readily accepted and she returned with THREE FastPasses for a family of FOUR! She stated that was all they had.
reviews.title: Sadly, not so Grand anymore

likes.liked: — Proximity to Magic Kingdom and monorail service
likes.disliked: — Customer service has become nonexistent at this resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our next disappointment was with housekeeping in our room -- Sago Key, Room 4511. Upon check-in, there was a large "glob" of toothpaste on the bathroom door that I cleaned up -- how someone could have missed it, I don't know. Within seconds we found a "razor guard" on the floor that would have easily been picked up in a vacuum sweeper had someone actually vacuumed. These types of oversights upon check-in can only make you guess what else has not been attended to! I did put a call into housekeeping and shared this information with them and a manager did come to our room to apologize but the service never improved and I stopped leaving a gratuity after the second day. Our shower was so slow-draining that, by the end of your shower, you were standing in water up to your ankles which is just gross. Why housekeeping did not resolve this issue with maintenance, I don't know. Also, our bathroom door kept locking on it's own ... go figure! We had to call maintenance twice and the second time was first thing in the morning when we were all trying to get ready to make an ADR for a character breakfast. Despite two phone calls and a 45-minute wait, we never saw anyone from maintenance and our boys resorted to urinating in two empty water bottles since they couldn't wait any longer. Call me crazy but I expect better service than this when paying in excess of $400/night for a room. I have received better service than this when staying at "chain" hotels.
reviews.title: A Magical Time??

reviews.text: Lastly, on our last day when we were checking out, we resorted to getting a luggage trolley on our own as no one was showing up to our room. On our way to the front entrance, one of the porters actually stopped his cart with other Grand guests sitting in it with him and reprimanded us for taking the trolley. He had the gall to admonish us and tell us we better make sure we got the trolley back to our building! No offer of help, no offer to call anyone ... nothing! Nothing but disparate words for us in front of other guests! I stopped at the desk on our way out and told one of the desk personnel of our experience being admonished by one of your porters -- her response to me was that she didn't know what "admonished" meant.
reviews.title: Great Resort for an Awesome Vacation

likes.liked: — The luxury that was found everywhere.
likes.disliked: — The noise from the hallways could get noisy.

reviews.text: I have always left the Grand happily planning our next visit, but not this time. The value for the cost was totally absent and our stay was very disappointing.
reviews.title: Big Disney Hotel - Over rated and Over priced

likes.disliked: — Expensive, separate buildings from main area with restaurants & entertaiment, Expensive

reviews.text: When we checked into the Grand Floridian on their inclusive Platinum Program, we were happy with the hotel and the people. All seemed great until the evening. The family next to us had two or three (seemed like 15) kids that did nothing but scream from 6:00 pm until 1:00 am. Then it started up again at 5:00 am. We complained to the front desk, then with the woman who checked us in. Then when nothing was done, we called security. What a difference it is talking to Disney security as compared to other "Cast members". They basically told us they could not interfere unless the "Duty Officer" told them to. This family stayed the entire length of our stay and completely ruined the experience. Other than this problem everything else was pretty good. I dont know exactly how to deal with something like this, but I am sure other hotels and resorts have a way. I wish someone would tell Disney
reviews.title: Superb Stay

likes.disliked: — Acess to parks other than Magic Kingdom

reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Floridian Nov. 21st thru Nov. 28th. From the moment we arrived we had an amazing time. Penny at the front desk chose a corner room for us with 2 outside decks, one facing the Magic Kingdom and one facing the Polynesian. When she heard we were there celebrating my 40th birthday she made every effort to ensure our stay would be wonderful. With an amazing view of the castle, we watched the light parade on the water and the fireworks 5 out of 7 nights that we were there.She was worried because there was a tree to the right of the deck that faced Cinderella's Castle. I have no idea why considering it did not impair our view at all. The room was clean and extremely spacious. Housekeeping was polite and accomodating in every way. My kids LOVED the pools. We spent most of our pool time on the waterslide and under the waterfall. On Thankgiving evening we ate at Narcosees. The food and service were exceptional, 5 star dining, could be a little pricey if you have little ones. We watched the fireworks from our table as we ate our "Nemo" cupcakes. Being on the monorail makes commuting to the parks much easier. There are also buses that will take you directly to and from Hollywood Studios and Animal Kingdom as well. We took advantage of the early and late hours...mostly at the Magic Kingdom which paid off when we rode Space Mountain, Pirates of the Caribbean and Splash Mountain three times in a row each without even getting off the rides! I highly recommend staying at the Grand Floridian it is absolutely worth every penny!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful trip and hotel!

reviews.text: I am a Disney world junkie. Love the experience every time I go. Over the years, I have been to Disney about 15 times. The Grand Floridian is the most beautiful hotel. The location is excellent. The staff very helpful. Here is where I was turned on to H2O shampoo - best shampoo ever. A little pricey but if you have the money, it is the place to stay.
reviews.title: On my bucket list

reviews.text: We are hosting an exchange student from Germany this year, and in an attempt to give her the full "American Experience", we couldn't think of anything more American than Disney. Looking at schedules, we found a 3 day weekend from school and decided to cram in a crash course in Disney. After considering many housing options, including using points to stay at an off site Marriott, we decided that if we only had three days, we needed the convenience of a stay on the monorail. With fond memories of a vacation at the Grand Floridian about 15 years ago, we decided to stay there again.
reviews.title: Can't beat the location
Beautiful rooms and even better views
reviews.text: As other reviews have indicated, the hotel has not exactly aged well. At first glance, the main building is beautiful and definitely gives the illusion of victorian elegance, but only the lucky few get to stay there. The rest of us get chucked into the outbuildings. I don't remember the cute name they gave ours, but it equated to building number 9, room 9514. The "top floor" as the desk clerk informed us - which admittedly did result in a cool vaulted ceiling with ceiling fans. What we did not realize at check in was that this specific room, as well as those below us were in one of the "towers" of the victorian style building. Because the tower juts out into the architecture, these rooms do NOT get a balcony. Not a huge deal, but something we missed. What you get instead is a little extra space in the hexagon shaped tower which meant a little couch, chair, coffee table and a separate TV. The couch did not fold out (which would have been nice) and this furniture was by far the worst in the room. While the wallpaper in the room did appear to be relatively new, the furniture did not.

The only reason any of these things even get mentioned is because of the cost. This room was part of a Disney "package" that if you break it apart cost us about $500 a night. I've stayed in $500 a night rooms, and they do not look at the pool. But it's Disney. We could have done the same vacation for FAR LESS money, but we would have lost the convenience of being on the monorail - and with the packages we booked (through AAA), this was the cheapest hotel. We already limited the girls to going only to Magic Kingdom and EPCOT, spending all of our time in busses or shuttles staying at the Disney All-Star Resorts or something would have killed what limited time we had. To our daughters, the hotel was bliss, and they think I am being too picky. But that's what TripAdvisor is for.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Disney complex!

reviews.text: We probably wouldn't have done anything differently, and there was nothing about the hotel that caused us to think even remotely about complaining or asking for a change. But do not think you get what you pay for - you will be very disappointed. Pay for the convenience, enjoy the Disney magic that is all around you, and recognize it's just money
reviews.title: Top Notch Experience in the GF Villas

reviews.text: We have stayed at a number of resorts at Walt Disney World and this was by far the best yet. I met my daughter, husband and 2 young children and we shared a room. The room was clean and roomy. We had a balcony overlooking the lagoon and the show at night was as perfect as looking at the view during the day. The 3 pools were great and the children really enjoyed the pirate one which is more of a splash park.
reviews.title: beautiful setting

reviews.text: The grounds and service were impeccable.
reviews.title: Perfection!

reviews.text: We all agreed that the grill restaurant was not up to par. You wait in line and tell them what you want and pay at the register. (kind of like a cafeteria) We took our #'s and sat down....waited and waited for our food. It was not crowded (now I know why) and my daughter went to check on our orders. She received hers minutes later, but mine did not come for another 5 minutes....and we all agree it was not worth waiting for! We did not go back, but ate at the pool etc. The other restuarants were great.
reviews.title: Great location but....

reviews.text: Our family consisting of 3 adults decided to take a vacation after a very difficult year and decided on Disney World. We have been to Disney many times since it opened but this was our first time staying at the Grand Floridian. The room was beautiful with a view from the patio overlooking the marina. The room was spotless, comfortable, and very large. We ordered room service several times and it was both reasonable and very good. The family also enjoyed several of the restaurants inside the resort including the Cafe for breakfast, Park Fare for character breakfast, Citricos for dinner, and my personal favorite Narcoosee's for dinner. Having so many dining options close by was a huge time saver and the food was incredible. This hotel has all of that Disney magic you would expect and then some.
reviews.title: Dream hotel not so dreamy
Excellent Experience!
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel after our cruise for 2 nights and stayed in the Sugar loaf concierge building. The room was large and nice however the dining area in the lounge was small and very crowded.
Stayed at the GF 4 nights over the Memorial Day weekend. My wife and two young girls shared a room with 2 beds and a cot in the Sugar Loaf Concierge building.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — An extension of the Disney experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very comfortable and well appointed. Very clean and the housekeeping staff always left little fun "surprises" in the room. We had a marina view which was ok - but most rooms in that building have either marina or pool view (no MK view). However, from my balcony, you could actually see the fireworks (we were at the very end so we had a decent angle). It was better to just take the very short walk to the marina for the fireworks. The food offerings and having the concierge in the building were both excellent. Nice to grab a snack, coffee, drink without getting nickle and dimed to death. Although we did the Disney dining plan, it still made sense to be in the concierge level and would absolutely do it again.
reviews.title: Grand, Indeed!

reviews.text: The location of the property, is of course, ideal. One quick stop on the monorail to get to MK and first stop back by boat. Can not beat that when traveling with little kids. We took advantage of the "disney resort hours" both early and late and were able to come back to the hotel inbetween. The two pools were nice and the one pool with the slide was perfect for kids. I will note here how efficient the lifegaurds at this pool were. Unlike many life gaurds who passively sit on a chair working on their tans, these lifegaurds were very pro-active and watchfull and gave my wife and I a very high level of comfort while our kids were in the pool.
reviews.title: Fantastic They certainly know customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course, the grounds were immaculate - very much an extension of the Disney experience. My wife did mention to me that the gym had machines that were not working and that overall the gym was disappointing. All other aspects of the grounds, restaraunts, etc.. were excellent, as was the service.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Suprise

likes.liked: — cleanliness, exceptional service, great concierge treats and drinks
likes.disliked: — The hotel was along the lines of a more upscale hotel for a romantic getaway or for families with older kids. Unfortunately, many of the families with young children picked this hotel over one of the other resort hotels that may have been more kid-friendly. The amount of young children was a bit overwhelming. However, we were at Disney, so kids are expected.

reviews.text: We did the Hoop Dee Doo Review (a must) and the Luau (so-so).
reviews.title: Stay somewhere Cheaper get treated better!
Disappointed with Grand Floridian
reviews.text: I had stayed at the Grand Floridian before, as at the Polynesian and Contemporary. This time I went with my family, including two children, for New Year´s Eve; As everyone knows, the place is very handsome, but surprise! as soon as we got there we were warned that we could not get a meal inside the hotel unless previously reserved. eVEN BREAKFAST! With two children, we decided not to submit them to long lines and had room service every day. For other meals, we had to go to another hotel or one of the parks.That seems to me absolutely ridiculous. The hotel was clearly overbooked andnot worried over their guests´well-being. For the sort of price you pay there, I felt definitely cheated. They should not fill to overflowing, making it imposible for their own guests to have a meal inside the hotel.

And more: I asked once to use an internet, which I imagined I would have to pay at some business center. Front desk told me where to go - it was closed and I was told to use the one at the Contemporary, where we had had dinner three nights. Well, I will stay elsewhere next time...
reviews.title: Nothing but first class the whole way

likes.disliked: — That I can't stay there every time I go to Disney.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Floridian for our wedding in October 2008 and had an amazing experience.
reviews.title: Customer service in booking and when we arrived

likes.liked: — it looked a the disney castle

reviews.text: Due to the fact that it was for our wedding, we were upgraded for free from our standard room to the club level in the main building. The food was always really great on the club level and it was nice to have free sodas and water available at any time. On our first night we got complimentary champagne and roses in the room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, but overpriced

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was exceptionally clean and the recent renovations in the rooms are just beautiful. The bed was comfortable and the room was very quiet.
reviews.title: The Magical Grand Floridian

reviews.text: We had always wanted to stay at the Grand Floridian but did not for budgetary reasons. We received a coupon for 40% off off peak stays so we decided to give it a try. We loved the convenience to the parks, the staff was really nice and attentive to us. We did not have any of the other negative experiences that other people had. After a long day at the park, it was nice to feel we were at a nice resort and not just a place to lay our heads down. We were upgraded to a lagoon side room. This is a very nice property and we enjoyed all the amenities and activities for the kids. The pools were nice.
reviews.title: Good to do once...

likes.disliked: — dated feeling, did not feel as if you were at the premier hotel at disney world

reviews.text: That being said, this is definitely not worth all the money they charge you. We have stayed at other "five star " properties and the Grand Floridian didn't have half the amenities that the other hotels had. The property feels slightly dated. The food choices are poor especially if you just want to grab a quick bite at Gaspirrilla's grill. thank god we had a car and we were able to go other places to eat. We have stayed at the Contemporary and Wilderness lodge and they were definitely worth the price being charged.
reviews.title: Not worth the money they charge........but ok if you want to be ripped off!!

likes.liked: — close to the magic kingdom and epcot
likes.disliked: — food was terrible and hotel is way over priced

reviews.title: Pass! Run While You Can!
reviews.text: This is worth doing once for the experience but if you want a good value for your money in this category of hotels at Disney I would go to the contemporary, polynesian or the wilderness lodge. They charge less and you still have a great location to the parks.

We had a Disney holiday booked orginally staying at the Disney Polynesion, but sadly the company we had booked with went into adminastration and closed down so we had to book another holiday....with only 10 weeks till we were meant to be travelling and with 2 little girls who were excited about their "Magical Disney Holiday" we had no choice but to book with a different travel company....because it was so close to our 1st travel date and with it also being a popular time of year..Dec 7th 2008, the only hotel that was available (and with what we thought were good reviews) was the Disney Grand Floridian Resort & Spa....we booked it and thought we were on our way to an amazing hotel to enjoy our Magical Holiday.....If Only!!!!!!
reviews.title: ROBBED IN MY ROOM!!!!!!!!!!!

likes.disliked: — having money stolen out of my room

reviews.text: So my husband and I (and friends) first made a reservation to Disney's Yacht Club. But when we saw all the bad reviews, we decided to move our reservation to Disney's Grand Floridian.
reviews.title: Great! We had an awesome time!!

reviews.text: The Grand Floriidan Concierge-Sugar Loaf was a great experience. WOW, what service...having your name come up as a GF Concierge guest got us extra perks and superb service. The food presentations were nice, enjoyed breakfast and dinner hour the best. The Resort itself is very soft spoken, very quiet, upscale but not uptight. Spend a little extra, get spoiled for life, we will be back! Narcoosees is the best restaurant at the GF, totally fabulous. The sorbet with fresh berries, yum. Traveled with a family of four, two boys(8 and 12), wife and myself. Pools were nice and not overly crowded, unlike BC and YC pools. Spend the extra $ and you will be amazed.
reviews.title: Loved the Grand Floridian

reviews.title: This hotel is about the experience of being at Disney
Just Amazing - UK Traveller
reviews.text: From the moment we stepped off the Magical Express Coach I knew this was going to be a wonderful holiday.
The hotel reception is just beautiful and a wonderful sight after a 9 hour flight! The staff can't help you enough, they are all so friendly and helpful - such a difference from where we come from!!
reviews.title: What's to complain about?

reviews.text: Our room was simply perfect and the maid greeted us every day with little animals made from the towels.
reviews.title: Most magical trip for our family

reviews.text: Our cases were delivered to our room about 90 minutes after we arrived, and placed neatly in a corner. - The Magical Express Paperwork states it may take up to 3 hours so we thought this was very good service.
reviews.title: the most beautiful place

reviews.text: We often had lunch in the quick service eaterie by the lake and sat looking out over Cinderellas castle. We also ate at Citricos and Florida Cafe and of course we had a character breakfast at Park Fare. Citricos was by far our favourite as the staff were even friendlier in there. Everywhere you go the staff make you smile with their friendliness - of course it is their job, but your'e not made to feel like it is just a job, you really feel special there. We did eat out at the Contempary, which was nice but a little too modern for me, although the view of the fireworks from the 15th floor restaurant were lovely! The Grand Floridian was the most spectacular hotel on the lake and we felt our disney experience was carried on after leaving whichever park that day to go back to such an inviting hotel. Yes it is expensive but as someone has already said you know the price before you go there, what on earth can you complain about? I cannot believe all the staff that helped make our holiday special suddenly turn in to rude staff when the high season comes in to action. The Reception staff and the information desk went out of their way to help us with any query we had at any time.
reviews.title: I coulda been a contender...

likes.liked: — Location and convenience to Magic Kingdom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at other Disney properties before, and this one is by far the best yet. The rooms were large & comfortable for our family of 4. The in room fridge allowed us to have a quick in room breakfast every morning.

description: Disney's Grand Floridian Resort & Spa is a Victorian-style Disney Deluxe Resort distinguished as the flagship hotel of Walt Disney World Resort and offering world-class dining, entertainment and luxurious accommodations in its 6 striking red-gabled buildings. This magnificent hotel sits along the white-sand shores of Seven Seas Lagoon.
